Description: Gold amulet; recumbent female figure; both hands clasped over breast; girdle round waist from which two serpents (uraei?) spring; lower part of body is in the form of a hand with the first finger pointing; two rings for suspension are soldered at the back with one vertically underneath the head and the other horizontally at the bottom; hollow.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (3010)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
